topComments.comment: Bom!

Chegamos por √°gua, mas n√£o tenho certeza se essa √© a √∫nica maneira de chegar l√°. N√≥s at√© vimos macacos bugios descansando no calor.  (Original) Very interesting tour. topComments.author: ChrisPandHisFlyingV
topComments.comment: (Tradu√ß√£o do Google) Tirando a chuva intermitente, que pode acontecer e acontece regularmente em qualquer dia do ano, esta foi uma excurs√£o de carnaval muito legal. (Original) Other than the on and off rain, which can and does regularly happen on any day of the year, this was a very cool Carnival excursion. topComments.author: Stijn Floren
topComments.comment: (Tradu√ß√£o do Google) Tivemos um tempo incr√≠vel. O parque est√° muito bem conservado e as ru√≠nas neste cen√°rio de selva foram definitivamente deslumbrantes. Mas qual foi o destaque real foram os muitos encontros com animais que tivemos. Voc√™ deve definitivamente fazer o passeio de barco de Orange Walk Town para Lamanai. A vida selvagem do rio √© abundante (vimos crocodilos, ma√ßaricos, falc√µes e muito mais). Os avistamentos no s√≠tio arqueol√≥gico foram ainda melhores. Vimos macacos-aranha, tucano, quatimundis, tar√¢ntula e tivemos um encontro pr√≥ximo com um grupo de bugios ü§© (dica: fique na casa de Ricky em Orange Walk Town e pe√ßa Amir Reyes como seu guia)  (Original) We had an amazing time. The park is very well kept and the ruins in this jungle setting were definitely stunning. But what was the actual highlight were the many animal encounters we had. You should definitely take the boat ride from Orange Walk Town to Lamanai. The river wildlife is plentiful (we saw crocodiles, kingfishers, falcons and much more). The sightings in the archeological site were even better. We saw spider monkeys, toucan, coatimundis, tarantula and had a close encounter with a group of howler monkeys ü§© (pro-tip: stay at Ricky's place in Orange Walk Town and ask him for Amir Reyes as your guide)

Definitely worth visiting.

topComments.author: Daniela Gaudino

Lamanai ostenta a terceira estrutura maia mais alta de Belize, apropriadamente chamada de Alto Templo, com 33 metros de altura. Talvez a caracter√≠stica mais ic√¥nica de Lamanai seja o Templo da M√°scara. As m√°scaras apresentadas neste templo t√™m 4,2 m de altura.  üåüùïÉùî∏ùïÑùî∏‚Ñïùî∏ùïÄ: ùïã‚Ñçùîº ‚ÑùùïåùïÄ‚Ñïùïäüåü ‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢ Ôº¢Ôº•Ôº¨Ôº©Ôº∫Ôº• ‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢ „Äã Lamanai √© um s√≠tio arqueol√≥gico da Mesoam√©rica e j√° foi uma grande cidade da civiliza√ß√£o maia, localizada no norte de Belize, no distrito de Orange Walk. O nome do local √© pr√©-colombiano, registrado pelos primeiros mission√°rios espanh√≥is e documentado mais de um mil√™nio antes em inscri√ß√µes maias  üåüùïÉùî∏ùïÑùî∏‚Ñïùî∏ùïÄ: ùïÉùïÜ‚Ñïùîæùîºùïäùïã ùïÜ‚ÑÇ‚ÑÇùïå‚Ñôùî∏ùïãùïÄùïÜ‚Ñïüåü ‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢ Ôº¢Ôº•Ôº¨Ôº©Ôº∫Ôº• ‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢ „Äã Essas ru√≠nas t√™m uma caracter√≠stica particular que √© diferente da maioria das ru√≠nas maias; est√° perto de um CORPO DE √ÅGUA. Gra√ßas a isso, Lamanai conseguiu ter o per√≠odo de ocupa√ß√£o mais longo de qualquer s√≠tio maia, desde o s√©culo 16 aC at√© o s√©culo 17 dC „Ää  (Original) December 2021 üåüùïÉùî∏ùïÑùî∏‚Ñïùî∏ùïÄ ùïÑùî∏ùïêùî∏‚Ñï ‚ÑùùïåùïÄ‚Ñïùïäüåü ‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢…¥·¥è Ä·¥õ ú·¥á Ä…¥  ô·¥á ü…™·¥¢·¥á‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢ „ÄãLamanai is the Maya word for ‚Äúsubmerged crocodile.Lamanai boasts the third tallest Maya structure in Belize, aptly called High Temple, which stands 33 meters tall. Perhaps the most iconic feature of Lamanai is the Mask Temple. The masks featured on this temple is 4.2 m high.  üåüùïÉùî∏ùïÑùî∏‚Ñïùî∏ùïÄ: ùïã‚Ñçùîº ‚ÑùùïåùïÄ‚Ñïùïäüåü ‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢Ôº¢Ôº•Ôº¨Ôº©Ôº∫Ôº•‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢ „ÄãLamanai is a Mesoamerican archaeological site, and was once a major city of the Maya civilization, located in the north of Belize, in Orange Walk District. The site's name is pre-Columbian, recorded by early Spanish missionaries, and documented over a millennium earlier in Maya inscriptions  üåüùïÉùî∏ùïÑùî∏‚Ñïùî∏ùïÄ: ùïÉùïÜ‚Ñïùîæùîºùïäùïã ùïÜ‚ÑÇ‚ÑÇùïå‚Ñôùî∏ùïãùïÄùïÜ‚Ñïüåü ‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢Ôº¢Ôº•Ôº¨Ôº©Ôº∫Ôº•‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢ „ÄãThese ruins have a particular characteristic that is different from most Maya ruins; it is close to a BODY OF WATER. Thanks to this, Lamanai managed to have the longest occupation span of any Maya site, spanning from the 16th¬†century BC until the 17th¬†century AD„Ää
